Crimes.Crime_Name: Inadmissibility under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the IAD's decision was patently unreasonable or involved an error of law
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA) s. 28(1)
Crimes.Application_Facts: Angeles spent only 360 days in Canada from 1997 to 2002
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: IAD dismissed appeal; removal order upheld
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review to overturn IAD decision
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Federal Court dismissed application for judicial review
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Non-compliance with IRPA s. 28(1) residency obligation
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Physical presence in Canada over five-year period
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Alleged procedural unfairness in IAD process
Crimes.Application_Basis: Failure to satisfy minimum residency requirement
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Cancellation of removal order and retention of status
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Insufficient evidence or documentation provided by applicant
Crimes.Cause_Description: Did not meet 730-day physical presence requirement under IRPA
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: IAD considered available evidence and found no error
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Travel records reviewed; insufficient presence confirmed
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Permanent resident must be physically present for at least 730 days in five years
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to provide adequate documentation to support appeal
